history.content:
Don't miss ANY week of CS 70, especially the first week. your life will become significantly harder if you do so.

It is entirely up to the instructors if they want to do this; I wouldn't expect them to though. (That said, most resources will still be online.)

But keep in mind that the first midterm will probably be in the fourth week, so you'll be missing a third of the material for that exam.

-

I think you will be fine. I dropped CS 70 for about a week at the beginning of the semester, and added it back right before midterm 1 while using the weekend (MT1 was on Monday) to rush through the materials and did ok on the first midterm, so you'll probably be fine.

Don't miss ANY week of CS 70, especially the first week. your life will become significantly harder if you do so.

It is entirely up to the instructors if they want to do this; I wouldn't expect them to though. (That said, most resources will still be online.)

But keep in mind that the first midterm will probably be in the fourth week, so you'll be missing a third of the material for that exam.
Don't miss ANY week of CS 70, especially the first week. your life will become significantly harder if you do so.

children.subject: I mean, if it can't be helped, I'm sure you can watch the corresponding Fall/Spring lectures and still do the homework. The discussion worksheets are generally released afterwards, so just make sure to go and do those as well.

history.content: Will I still be able to catch up after missing the first week of CS70 during the summer? Will the instructors give me materials to study during the first week or will I have to catch up after I come back?
history.subject: Missing the first week of CS70
